summary: An email from a federal prosecutor in the Southern District of New York to an unspecified recipient, requesting assistance in contacting current and former Palm Beach Police Department employees to testify at the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The prosecutor seeks to authenticate evidence gathered during the PBPD's 2005 investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, particularly from the search of his residence in October 2005.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution in United States v. Maxwell, identified as Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirator.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose co-conspirator, Ghislaine Maxwell, is being prosecuted; his 2005 investigation by PBPD is central to the evidence being authenticated.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email, handling the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell and seeking assistance in contacting PBPD witnesses for the upcoming trial.

connections.description: Maxwell is explicitly identified as Epstein's co-conspirator in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell.
The prosecutor is handling the federal prosecution of Maxwell in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Palm Beach Residence
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department conducted a search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence as part of their 2005 investigation.

events.title: Prosecutor's Request for Witness Assistance
events.description: A federal prosecutor emailed an unspecified recipient to request assistance in contacting PBPD witnesses for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is a 2021 email from a federal prosecutor preparing for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein's co-conspirator.
The prosecution plans to introduce evidence from the Palm Beach Police Department's 2005 investigation of Epstein, specifically from the October 2005 search of his residence.
The prosecutor seeks assistance in contacting current and former PBPD employees to authenticate this evidence at trial.
The case is United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), in the Southern District of New York.
The email indicates ongoing trial preparation efforts by the prosecution team to secure witness testimony.
